node.title: Add camomile
node.body:
As discussed in the RFC https://github.com/unifiedjs/rfcs/pull/9, here is the implementation of camomile, our Node.js image proxy to work together with [`rehype-github-image`](https://github.com/rehypejs/rehype-github/tree/main/packages/image).

## How it works

camomile works together with `rehype-github-image`, which does the following at build time:

1.  The original URL in the content is parsed.
2.  An [HMAC][] signature of the URL is generated.
3.  The URL and HMAC are encoded.
4.  The encoded URL and HMAC are placed into the expected format, creating the signed URL.
5.  The signed URL replaces the original image URL.

After your web app serves the content to the user, camomile takes over:

1.  The client requests the signed URL from camomile.
2.  camomile validates the [HMAC][], decodes the URL, then requests the content from
    the origin server and streams it to the client.

## Features

- A `maxSize` option in bytes to limit the downloading of resources (failing if exceeded)
- Security. Only HTTP(s) is allowed, no other protocols. Protection built-in for [Server-Side Request Forgery](https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Server_Side_Request_Forgery).
- Filtering of headers. Request headers from the client which we want to pass on to the remote server and response headers from the remote server to the client.

## Future additions

- Allow audio and video content through options
- Respect forwarded headers
- Structured logging (with log levels)
- Add events (`server.on('foo', () => {})`)
- Compression

## Time spent

36 hours (without implementing feedback)

[HMAC]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC

nodes.bodyText: I think this is ready now. All open comments have a response from me now. There are some comments which mostly seem to be subjective aesthetics / nits, which I wouldn't make blocking for merge but willing to discuss in each thread. There is the comment about rounding down versions numbers, which I find odd but willing to change of course if that is considered blocking.

I think this is good to go now @Murderlon? Do you want to merge this, shall I do it?
Can I help you with the invoice? (Perhaps this can be discussed on the rfc?)
we got the npm name, released! https://github.com/rehypejs/camomile/releases/tag/1.0.0

Maybe a stupid question, as a non-native English person, I don't quite get why camomile is chosen to be the package name? How does it relate to what it does under the hood? And when I want to add such feature in my app, how can I get to know I should use camomile instead of other tools.

The original project that is unmaintained was called "camo", which is a shortening of camouflage.
This package name also starts with camo, so it's a play on that related work.
In the readme you can find a section "when should I use this?" which answers your second question!
OK, actually I mean the discoverability of the package. Usually projects under rehypejs use rehype-x (x is exactly what it does), right?

It's a bit of an outlier indeed, but in this case the rehype prefix would be more confusing as it implies it being a plugin. Since it's a server, which is completely different from anything else in this org, a different name makes sense. And with a different name why not a wordplay on what it was inspired by :)

My point is still the discoverability of the package. I'm fine with name without rehype-. 😂
But if you think keywords in package.json is already fine, that's OK to me either.

Yes, we cannot use rehype-, that means plugins/presets. This is something else.
Choosing a meaningful name is nice for something like node-fetch for fetch. But when there isn’t really one word, or that name is already taken, I like using a fun name, a play on words.
Like undici for fetching.
Or MDX, or remark.
I don’t worry about discoverability. The keywords and description and the partial match of camo in camomile are fine.
And a link in the related project rehype-github-image soon, should do the trick!

node.bodyText:
Super exciting! I’ve pinged the camomile npm owner again!
First part of nits :)
should there be a coverage test / codecov integration?

a) I prefer putting config in package.json when possible, and this should be possible there
b) can you sort the keys alphabetically?
Same, put this in package.json? Why not?
This should probably export Options (currently called Config) from server.js, so folks can import that type? Anything else that needs exporting???

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            export * from './lib/constants.js'
          
          
            
            export {DEFAULT_HEADERS, REQUEST_HEADERS, RESPONSE_HEADERS, IMAGE_MIME_TYPES} from './lib/constants.js'
          
      
    
    
  

Beter to use actual export identifiers than a *
Should all these constants be exported? For what?

I don‘t think @constant does anything in TS? What is the intention?
Currently, TS infers this as: const DEFAULT_HEADERS: {'X-Frame-Options': string;...}`, is that intentional? Should it be a record of strings to strings? Should it be readonly?
And: should they be exposed?
(same for all other exported records)

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            /**
          
          
            
             * http request headers that are acceptable to pass from
          
          
            
             * the client to the remote server. Only those present and true, are forwarded.
          
          
            
             * @constant
          
          
            
             */
          
          
            
            /**
          
          
            
             * HTTP request headers that are acceptable to pass from the client to the
          
          
            
             * remote server.
          
          
            
             * Only those present and true are forwarded.
          
          
            
             * 
          
          
            
             * @type {Readonly<Map<string, boolean>>}
          
          
            
             */
          
      
    
    
  

Docs, readonly, explicit type

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              ['X-Forwarded-For', false], // x-forwarded-for header is not blindly passed without additional custom processing
          
          
            
              ['Range', true] // required to support safari byte range requests for video
          
          
            
              // `Range` is used by Safari for byte range requests on video:
          
          
            
              ['Range', true],
          
          
            
              // No `X-Forwarded-For` because ???
          
          
            
              ['X-Forwarded-For', false]
          
      
    
    
  

Sorting, casing, code. Note: why no x-forwarded-for?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            /**
          
          
            
             * http response headers that are acceptable to pass from
          
          
            
             * the remote server to the client. Only those present and true, are forwarded.
          
          
            
             * @constant
          
          
            
             */
          
          
            
            export const RESPONSE_HEADERS = new Map([
          
          
            
              ['Accept-Ranges', true], // required to support Safari byte range requests for video
          
          
            
              ['Content-Length', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Range', true],
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
              ['Cache-Control', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Encoding', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Type', true],
          
          
            
              ['ETag', true],
          
          
            
              ['Expires', true],
          
          
            
              ['Last-Modified', true],
          
          
            
              ['Server', false], // override in response with either nothing, or ServerNameVer
          
          
            
              ['Transfer-Encoding', true]
          
          
            
            ])
          
          
            
            /**
          
          
            
             * HTTP response headers that are acceptable to pass from the remote server to
          
          
            
             * the client.
          
          
            
             * Only those present and true are forwarded.
          
          
            
             *
          
          
            
             * @type {Readonly<Map<string, boolean>>}
          
          
            
             */
          
          
            
            export const RESPONSE_HEADERS = new Map([
          
          
            
              // `Accept-Ranges` is used by Safari for byte range requests on video:
          
          
            
              ['Accept-Ranges', true],
          
          
            
              ['Cache-Control', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Length', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Encoding', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Range', true],
          
          
            
              ['Content-Type', true],
          
          
            
              ['ETag', true],
          
          
            
              ['Expires', true],
          
          
            
              ['Last-Modified', true],
          
          
            
              // `Server` is disallowed because ???
          
          
            
              ['Server', false],
          
          
            
              ['Transfer-Encoding', true]
          
          
            
            ])
          
      
    
    
  

Same as above, remove random blank line, sorting. Note: why no server?

Note: I feel like the UPPERCASE stuff for “constants” like this is a bit archaic.
I prefer stuff like defaultMimeTypes, corresponding to say a options.mimeTypes; defaultResponseHeaders and options.responseHeaders, etc.
My humble opinion: code coverage is valuable for parsers and algorithms, a lot less interesting for for applications / servers.
Can also not export the constants indeed until people ask for it for some reason.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            import dns from 'node:dns/promises'
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            import {fetch} from 'undici'
          
          
            
            import ipaddr from 'ipaddr.js'
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            import {IMAGE_MIME_TYPES} from './constants.js'
          
          
            
            import dns from 'node:dns/promises'
          
          
            
            import ipaddr from 'ipaddr.js'
          
          
            
            import {fetch} from 'undici'
          
          
            
            import {IMAGE_MIME_TYPES} from './constants.js'
          
      
    
    
  

Sorting, no blank lines.
Q: As Node 16 is not maintained, we can go with Node 18 as a base here, which supports fetch. I wouldn’t do that for the unified plugins / utilities as half of them is just released with Node 16 support, so having mixed 16 and 18 minimum is complex, but as this is a new project intended for a very different place, we could do it here?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * @param {number} statusCode
          
          
            
               * @param {string} message
          
          
            
               */
          
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * Create an HTTP error.
          
          
            
               * 
          
          
            
               * @param {number} statusCode
          
          
            
               *   Status code.
          
          
            
               * @param {string} message
          
          
            
               *   Message.
          
          
            
               * @returns
          
          
            
               *   HTTP error.
          
          
            
               */
          
      
    
    
  

Not supor useful, but nice to have some docs.
Maybe CamomileError here? HttpError is quite non-descript

I’m not sure this needs to be a class? Particularly if it has one static member, the construct accepts one option field?
The name, not sure “safe” is needed on the class, and what is “client” here?

I’d almost call this file utilities.js, which exports checkUrl and safeFetch, where safeFetch accepts maxSize in its options?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * Check if the URL is a valid URL or IP, that the prototol is valid,
          
          
            
               * and the host is a safe unicast address.
          
          
            
               * @param {string} url
          
          
            
               */
          
          
            
              static async checkUrl(url) {
          
          
            
                // Throws if the URL is invalid
          
          
            
                const validUrl = new URL(url)
          
          
            
                const {protocol, hostname} = validUrl
          
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * Check that the URL is valid, the prototol is allowed, and that the host is
          
          
            
               * a safe unicast address.
          
          
            
               *
          
          
            
               * @param {string} url
          
          
            
               *   URL to check.
          
          
            
               * @returns {Promise<URL>}
          
          
            
               *   URL object.
          
          
            
               */
          
          
            
              static async checkUrl(url) {
          
          
            
                const validUrl = new URL(url)
          
          
            
                const {hostname, protocol} = validUrl
          
      
    
    
  

Docs, sorting.
Q: when a function is called checkUrl, I‘d assume it would only check and return a boolean, instead of returning a parsed URL. Throwing errors in “check” also seems not intuitive to me.
Alternatively, I can understand a checkUrl that throws errors and returns Promise<undefined>, aka nothing.
Last, it might make sense to use different status codes for different errors? Simplest would perhaps be to inline it in server.js. Or throw HttpErrors and use the error.statusCode || 400 on them in server.js?
Quickly thinking, maybe:
invalid url -> 400
bad protocol -> 403
bad url host (1, dns.lookup) -> 400
bad url host (2, ipaddr) -> 403

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * @param {string|URL} url
          
          
            
               * @param {import('undici').RequestInit} options
          
          
            
               */
          
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * Fetch a URL.
          
          
            
               * 
          
          
            
               * @param {URL | string} url
          
          
            
               *   URL.
          
          
            
               * @param {import('undici').RequestInit} options
          
          
            
               *   Configuration, passed through to `fetch`.
          
          
            
               * @returns {Promise<{buffer?: Buffer, headers: import('undici').Headers}>}
          
          
            
               *   Buffer of response (except when `HEAD`) and headers.
          
          
            
               */
          
      
    
    
  

Docs.

I needed undici anyway because of MockAgent in tests and since the package is there, might as well use the fetch export and not rely on a experimental Node >18 only feature. I can remove it, but it comes for free at this point.
It's not used outside the context of this server, so everything is inherently camomile related. Within this server, this is an HTTP error, so I think it's fine.

It is "safe" because it won't allow you to make dangerous HTTP requests and prevents large payload attacks. It's a client because we are on the receiving end.
Calling things "utils" / "utilities" is my personal pet peeve though, as it's generic not intention revealing naming.
I don't have a strong opinion on it being a class or not. It feels okay in this context, functions are also okay.

Throwing errors in “check” also seems not intuitive to me

For me it's the opposite, I do expect errors in this function.

Alternatively, I can understand a checkUrl that throws errors and returns Promise<undefined>, aka nothing.

That seems fine yes!

Last, it might make sense to use different status codes for different errors?

I don't think so, they are all client-side mistakes (intentional or not). I'm also happier not exposing too many details of the internals and rejecting everything "bad" regarding URLs with 400.
I think I prefer it the way it is. It's a simple inline check, no need to expose it globally in the file or function scope.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            import http from 'node:http'
          
          
            
            import net from 'node:net'
          
          
            
            import {EventEmitter} from 'node:events'
          
          
            
            import crypto from 'node:crypto'
          
          
            
            import url from 'node:url'
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            import {Headers} from 'undici'
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            import {SafeHttpClient, HttpError} from './safe-http-client.js'
          
          
            
            import {
          
          
            
              DEFAULT_HEADERS,
          
          
            
              REQUEST_HEADERS,
          
          
            
              RESPONSE_HEADERS
          
          
            
            } from './constants.js'
          
          
            
            import crypto from 'node:crypto'
          
          
            
            import {EventEmitter} from 'node:events'
          
          
            
            import http from 'node:http'
          
          
            
            import net from 'node:net'
          
          
            
            import url from 'node:url'
          
          
            
            import {Headers} from 'undici'
          
          
            
            import {
          
          
            
              DEFAULT_HEADERS,
          
          
            
              REQUEST_HEADERS,
          
          
            
              RESPONSE_HEADERS
          
          
            
            } from './constants.js'
          
          
            
            import {HttpError, SafeHttpClient} from './safe-http-client.js'
          
      
    
    
  

Sorting, no blank lines

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            /**
          
          
            
             * @typedef {Object} Config
          
          
            
             * @property {string} HMACKey
          
          
            
             * @property {string} serverName Server name used in Headers and Via checks
          
          
            
             * @property {number|undefined} [maxSize] The max size in bytes per resource to download. Sends 500 if exceeded.
          
          
            
             */
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            /**
          
          
            
             * @typedef Config
          
          
            
             *   Configuration.
          
          
            
             * @property {string} HMACKey
          
          
            
             *   Secret.
          
          
            
             * @property {string} serverName
          
          
            
             *   Name of server; used in `Headers` and `Via`.
          
          
            
             * @property {number | undefined} [maxSize]
          
          
            
             *   Max size in bytes per resource to download (default: `undefined`);
          
          
            
             *   If passed, sends a `404` if exceeded.
          
          
            
             */
          
      
    
    
  

More docs.
Q1: I prefer the name Options for such types.
Q2: how about secret, just like rehype-github-images, for the shared secret? Otherwise, I prefer hmacKey
Q3: I don’t think serverName is actually “checked” (current text?), it’s sent along though?
Q4: maxSize currently seems to send a 404?
Q5: should we set a default maxSize?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                bytes.push(parseInt(hex.substr(i, 2), 16))
          
          
            
                bytes.push(parseInt(hex.slice(i, 2), 16))
          
      
    
    
  

substr is deprecated, I think this works.
But: Buffer.from('68747470733a2f2f666f6f2e6261722f696d6167652e706e67', 'hex').toString() also decodes, so you can drop this function

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * @param {Config} config
          
          
            
               * @param {Readonly<Config>} config

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                this.config = config
          
          
            
                this.config.serverName ??= 'camo'
          
          
            
                this.config = {...config, serverName: config?.serverName || 'camo'}
          
      
    
    
  

Do not mutate the given object

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * Start the server. Identical to `net.Server.listen()`.
          
          
            
               * @param {Parameters<InstanceType<typeof net.Server>['listen']>} args
          
          
            
               * @public
          
          
            
               */
          
          
            
              /**
          
          
            
               * Start the server.
          
          
            
               * 
          
          
            
               * @param {Parameters<InstanceType<typeof net.Server>['listen']>} args
          
          
            
               *   Arguments passedf to `net.Server.listen`.
          
          
            
               * @returns {net.Server}
          
          
            
               *   Server.
          
          
            
               */
          
      
    
    
  

a) docs, b) @public is the default
Q: Should it be possible to stop the server?
Should be spelled verifyHmac

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              "dependencies": {
          
          
            
                "ipaddr.js": "^2.1.0",
          
          
            
                "undici": "^5.24.0"
          
          
            
              },
          
          
            
              "devDependencies": {
          
          
            
                "@types/node": "^18.17.15",
          
          
            
                "prettier": "^3.0.3",
          
          
            
                "remark-cli": "^11.0.0",
          
          
            
                "remark-preset-wooorm": "^9.1.0",
          
          
            
                "typescript": "^5.2.2"
          
          
            
              "dependencies": {
          
          
            
                "ipaddr.js": "^2.0.0",
          
          
            
                "undici": "^5.0.0"
          
          
            
              },
          
          
            
              "devDependencies": {
          
          
            
                "@types/node": "^18.0.0",
          
          
            
                "prettier": "^3.0.0",
          
          
            
                "remark-cli": "^11.0.0",
          
          
            
                "remark-preset-wooorm": "^9.0.0",
          
          
            
                "typescript": "^5.0.0"
          
      
    
    
  

Use loose version ranges if unknown. It creates cleaner package locks, and makes it easier for package managers to resolve conflicts

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Limit the maximum size of a resource in bytes (`number`, default: `null`).
          
          
            
            Limit the maximum size of a resource in bytes (`number`, default: `undefined`).
          
      
    
    
  

Don’t use null if possible, null isn‘t allowed as a value according to the types, undefined is also closer to not settings something
Why are the tests not checked?

Q1: I prefer the name Options for such types.

👍

Q2: how about secret, just like rehype-github-images, for the shared secret? Otherwise, I prefer hmacKey

👍

Q3: I don’t think serverName is actually “checked” (current text?), it’s sent along though?

Checked for what? It being a string you mean?

Q4: maxSize currently seems to send a 404?

Yes thinking to change it to 413 (Content Too Large).

Q5: should we set a default maxSize?

Probably a good idea yes. Here is what GPT thinks the default should be: https://chat.openai.com/share/188485eb-b6ee-4957-a96a-c112c1582544

a) are the headers case insensitive? If so, that should likely be noted in constant.js. I’d also then say we shouldn’t case them there at all?

According to the HTTP spec it doesn't matter. But it's definitely canonical to use Pascal-Case.

This also seems like the bool isn’t useful: false is treated the same as not being included in allowedHeaders at all. Perhaps sets are better?

It's handy to explicitly indicate what is not allowed and when respecting forwarded headers are allowed, we could change the value to true based on some checks. But Set may be good too here yes.

I don't understand why you would do this. GPT can't come up with the benefits either:
https://chat.openai.com/share/5e4aa769-4e0b-4214-a966-fec85c82cc2f

It allows package managers to deduplicate versions.
If a dependency is already being used without issue, there is no reason to force npm/yarn to install two copies of it.

That is a trade off not worth making in my opinion. Rounding down may introduce bugs or missing features if a package was at ^2.1.0 instead of ^2.0.0, there's usually a reason for that. Besides we can't guarantee it will dedupe versions in all cases. Sounds like taking risks for the small gain of using less disk space. Which is practically a XY problem, if disk space on your personal computer is a worry there are many ways to deal with that other than making our dependencies less predictable and safe.
I understand most of the unified ecosystem does this. But that's personally not a consistency I would enforce in all cases.
I generally prefer plain objects and functions. The only exception that comes to mind is custom errors.
I see why you used var here. It’s clever, but I’m not sure if I like it. Personally I would declare it above the try block.
I know the fetch global is technically experimental in Node.js, but I wouldn’t mind using that instead.
Why don’t we allow another redirect until we detect a loop or invalid redirect URL?

The linked video sparked a lot of discussion on Twitter. There isn’t really a general consensus on this topic for application code. For library code it’s different.
A quote from the video:

If you’re writing library code, you should always declare return types.

This gives you more control over the types that TypeScript will generate.
b) Let’s remove @public. Methods are public by default.
url.parse is deprecated. Let’s use new URL() instead.

On its own I don’t really think it matters that much which semver range you choose when starting a project. It does become a problem when updating.
I’ve seen packages update their semver ranges, and make a release for it. Then their dependants do the same thing. This can send a wave of pointless automated pull requests by dependency management bots throughout the ecosystem.
I like to keep things simple and consistent and use ^x.0.0 everywhere.
Node.js 16 is past EOL. Should we remove support for it for new projects?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            In Node.js (version 16+), install with [npm][]:
          
          
            
            In Node.js (version 18+), install with [npm][]:

I think it's pretty neat, especially compared to this:
    let address
    try {
      ;({address} = await dns.lookup(hostname))
However I agree in a large function this would get confusing with scope! In this case because it's so small I think it's fine?

Removing this in favor of global fetch didn't work as-is. It also can't find Headers in Typescript which I need. I think I prefer undici for now, it's a small but very solid library by node maintainers as well. If you two feel strongly I can investigate further 👍
You're right, we should indeed support multiple redirects.
If it does make a difference, then by all means keep using undici 👍
The more I look at it, the more I like it. Let’s keep it.
Q: forgot if I asked before, but should this be Server? Should we use Camomile or so?
Should this export types? Such as Options?
I'm not sure how with JSDoc, I can't export types from JS and the index.d.ts is generated and ignored by git?

Almost all of our packages export types. The JSDoc you write in JS results in exported types. Here is an example: https://github.com/rehypejs/rehype-sanitize/blob/main/index.js
To learn more about JSDoc, I recommend looking through what .d.ts files.

You can’t really re-export types, but you can create a type alias which behaves mostly similar.
In index.js:
/**
 * @typedef {import('./lib/server.js').Options} Options
 */
I think only options is useful? So something like: /** {@typedef {import('./lib/index.js').Options} Options */

node.title: feat(query-builder): move query builder library
node.body:
[CPT-994](https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-994) (reviewed by @toptal/core-platform ) [CPT-1216](https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-1216) (reviewed by @toptal/core-platform ) [CPT-993](https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-993) ### Description - [x] When the PR is draft, [CPT-994](https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-994) and [CPT-1216](https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-1216) can be checked from this draft PR. [@toptal/react-query-builder](https://github.com/toptal/staff-portal/tree/master/libs/react-query-builder) library will be moved from Staff Portal to Picasso. Initial files and stories are added in ths PR. PR will get out of draft status when [CPT-993](https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-993) is completed. (And will ping the reviewers with it.) ### How to test - [Temploy](https://picasso.toptal.net/CPT-993-fe-create-query-builder-library) - `@toptal/picasso-query-builder` library and its section in storybook is new in picasso. ### Screenshots ### Development checks - [x] Add changeset according to [guidelines](https://github.com/toptal/picasso/blob/master/docs/contribution/changeset-guidelines.md) (if needed) - [x] Read [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/toptal/picasso/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [Component API principles](https://github.com/toptal/picasso/blob/master/docs/contribution/component-api.md) - [x] Make sure that additions and changes on the design follow [Toptal's BASE design](https://design.toptal.net/), and it's been already discussed with designers at #-base-core - [x] Annotate all `props` in component with documentation - [x] Create `examples` for component - [x] Ensure that deployed demo has expected results and good examples - [x] Ensure the changed/created components have not caused accessibility issues. [How to use accessibility plugin in storybook](https://github.com/toptal/picasso/blob/master/docs/contribution/accessibility.md). - [x] Self reviewed - [x] Covered with tests ([visual tests](https://github.com/toptal/picasso/blob/master/docs/contribution/visual-testing.md) included) **Breaking change** - [N/A] codemod is created and showcased in the changeset - [x] test alpha package of Picasso in StaffPortal > All **_development checks_** should be done and set checked to pass the > **GitHub Bot: TODOLess** action
PR commands
List of available commands: - `@toptal-bot run package:alpha-release` - Release alpha version - `@toptal-anvil ping reviewers` - Ping FX team for review
PR Review Guidelines
#### When to approve? ✅ **You are OK** with merging this PR and 1. You have no extra requests. 2. You have optional requests. 1. Add `nit:` to your comment. (ex. `nit: I'd rename this variable from makeCircle to getCircle`) #### When to request changes? ❌ **You are not OK** with merging this PR because 1. Something is broken after the changes. 2. Acceptance criteria is not reached. 3. Code is dirty. #### When to comment (neither ✅ nor ❌) **You want your comments to be addressed** before merging this PR in cases like: 1. There are leftovers like unnecessary logs, comments, etc. 2. You have an opinionated comment regarding the code that requires a discussion. 3. You have questions. #### How to handle the comments? 1. An owner of a comment is the only one who can resolve it. 2. An owner of a comment must resolve it when it's addressed. 3. A PR owner must reply with ✅ when a comment is addressed.
[CPT-994]: https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-994?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ [CPT-1216]: https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-1216?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ [CPT-993]: https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-993?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ [CPT-994]: https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-994?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ [CPT-1216]: https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-1216?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ [CPT-993]: https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-993?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

node.bodyText: should we add some info to Changelog ? 🤔
this file is probably not needed if the styles approach is different in Picasso
this file is not needed as well, but probably will be removed while working on styles
same here as for other styles.ts/styles.tsx files
same here as for other styles.ts/styles.tsx files

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                Example of the Query Builder with custom operators. We can Override default operators from the fields with some custom values. 
          
          
            
                Example of the Query Builder with custom operators. We can override default operators from the fields with some custom values.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    validationResult: validValidationResult,
          
          
            
                    validationResult: validResult,

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    validationResult: invalidValidationResult,
          
          
            
                    validationResult: invalidResult,
I think it is generated automatically with conventional commits on release. Maybe I can add initial release notes. Lets clarify it with the FX teams review.
Kept the styles files,  converting them to jss in place.
Kept the styles files,  converting them to jss in place.
Kept the styles files,  converting them to jss in place.
Kept the styles files,  converting them to jss in place.
when called with a valid result sounds better
My statement above seems to be wrong, I have discussed with @dmaklygin , and it is cleat that I will create Changelog manually.
I left a few comments. I wonder if we should opt for the onEvent notation (for example the buttons), unless it is inherited from React query builder component props (MultiSelect as an example).

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            on the client-side. Generated query can be serialized into a format suitable
          
          
            
            on the client-side. Generated queries can be serialized into a format suitable
          
      
    
    
  

or
  
    
      
        Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
            on the client-side. Generated query can be serialized into a format suitable
          
          
            
            on the client-side. The generated query can be serialized into a format suitable
Do we have to talk about Filters in the Picasso library? It should be now a standalone component and users should not be aware of where it is used in other projects.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              handleOnClick,
          
          
            
              onClick,

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              handleOnClick,
          
          
            
              onClick,
          
      
    
    
  

in Picasso similar event name is usually prefixed with on
Will we need a test file for this component as in the AddGroupButton?

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              handleOnChange,
          
          
            
            onChange

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              handleTouched,
          
          
            
               onTouched,

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              handleOnClick,
          
          
            
              onClick,

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              handleOnClick,
          
          
            
              onClick,
This is an underlying prop of the core react-querybuilder's  AddGroupButton , which we do not expose and I believe it is not necessary to change.
Let's keep it this way, same reason with your other comment on AddGroupButton.
I will add missing tests on the upcoming ticket https://toptal-core.atlassian.net/browse/CPT-1023
I will resolve the rest of your similar comments, if you do not agree please comment.
Good job, I only went manually through the code, I haven't tested it in the storybook yet, will do it in next iteration 🙇

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                "@toptal/picasso": "^38.0.0",
          
          
            
                "@toptal/picasso": ">=38",
          
      
    
    
  

let's not be so strict here, as we are releasing Picasso quite often and we would have to update this all the time. And updating lower boundary of peer dependency is breaking change
Do we really expect that users will install @material-ui/core?

data-testid should be set in the test file itself, we don't want static test ids. This way it would be in DOM even when not in the test environment and some applications might not want that.
We usually do this by having testIds: { addRuleButton: 'string', ... } on the entry component.
we usually have index.ts with reexports, so we can have shorter imports. Can we add them for consistency?

OK, now I see that we use it for styles. I'm not sure if it is needed as a peer dependency. It is actually an internal way how we create styles, maybe we can just have it as a normal dependency? We are planning to migrate all styles to TailwindCSS in the future and I think users don't have to care about this. The fewer peer dependencies we have, the fewer breaking changes we will have when we need to update them or remove them.

can't we just use object destructuring to avoid fieldData={undefined}?
const {fieldData, ...rest} = props
Could we change the name? I think it is misleading a little bit as Picasso also has a context. I would be more explicit as this is actually QuiryBuilderContext, right?
as we were discussing in the introduction meeting, it would be cool to import this library only when it is used
static test-id

It is hard to get from the review, but it would be great to use all properties of QueryBuilder at least once in some of the examples. For example hideControls, and it would be great to have it covered with a screenshot.
Yes it makes sense, changed the version to ^>=38.0.0

Yes, I am also not sure if we can rely on @material-ui/core to be a peer dependency. Other occurrences in the repo made me think that it was discussed and decided before. But I will update it to be a dependency for now.
Is there a specific way to conditionally import in the repo?
We can change it for sure,  but it is also not the QueryBuilderContext. When the lib was in the staff portal it made sense, but here I understand your concern. I renamed it to ControlElementsContext.
Removed it, totally forgotten in development.
Yes i do not like the double ternary operator either.
https://chat.openai.com/share/d697466b-3b9d-49aa-a099-e53601499c92 Can you access this?

left a few more small comments, tested it in the temploy, looks good! If there are any issues with my previous comment about dynamic importing the DND library, we can discuss, or we can wait for other reviewers, maybe they might have different idea 🤔

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
                "@toptal/picasso": "^>=38.0.0",
          
          
            
                "@toptal/picasso": "^>=38.0.0",
          
      
    
    
  


https://jubianchi.github.io/semver-check/#/constraint/^%3E%3D38.0.0
should this be moved to the second line for consistency?
Updated as "@toptal/picasso": "^38.0.0",
Can you please specify if this value is coming from design?

Instruments are also defined in examples (https://github.com/toptal/picasso/pull/3872/files#diff-47a90dfbcc63fb195811530382fc1666768722ef9d8280d9eab7fa6c0a4bb9ecR15), is there a need to keep it in packages/picasso-query-builder/src/constants.ts (as it seems to be need for testing and demoing)?
Yep forgot to remove it when I moved contents to stories, only necessary constant left, and moved the constants.ts to utils folder.

AutoComplete is a custom value editor built on top of picasso's tag selector. There must be some kind of edge case scenario since the with is set so specifically, can not recall what it is atm. But the rest of the fields are flexible to the container.
oh :)

Given that onQueryChange is always called immediately after onQueryReset, and with a specific argument (emptyQueryBuilderQuery) that denotes a reset, I would consider it as redundant to have a separate onQueryReset prop for notifying about the reset action.
do you think, onQueryReset is still necessary here or redundant?
Got it, thanks! Is the overall design of the Query Builder approved by Design Team and aligned with BASE (I see the check list item is checked, but wanted to double-check)?
Should it be replaced with ControlElementsContext?
If this is an internal information on how library works, then I'd move the description to the corresponding files

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
               By default is set to 3.
          
          
            
               By default it is set to 3.

Wondering if there is a need to duplicate the list of properties here if we already have good description in packages/picasso-query-builder/src/QueryBuilder/QueryBuilder.tsx (this will be also used for Storybook)?
NIT: What do you think about keeping the name unified with Picasso Autocomplete? Otherwise it might cause confusion, I think
I would specify type for this fieldValidatorMap.

I would not have this condition, I would instead use queryBuilderValidator returned by a useQueryBuilderValidator hook.
customValidator should be passed to useQueryBuilderValidator hook, so the hook should handle custom validation
this handler should be inside useQueryBuilderValidator hook

I would have an explicit function that determines whether rule is a group or a single group, so it should return a proper type, for example:
const isRuleGroup = () => result is RuleGroupTypeAny
Link: https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/advanced-types.html#using-type-predicates
I would specify a return type for the function

to have a consistent types definition, I would use either Record or {[key]} here.
Here, we use Record
I would not set a type here: as RuleGroupTypeAny. compiler should know exact type of rule here. So we do not need to do it
Please, define a type for result
We should specify a return type for this function
react-querybuilder has already provided this function isRuleGroup

actually, we should cover as much as possible cases:

When query is a group of rules
When a query is a single rule
When fields are empty
etc
I think, having two callbacks that are called exactly at the same time, is quite odd. I would keep only a single callback.
I think we could call this function only once and use cached value here

I would wrap it within useCallback.
Also, I would create a default getDefaultOperators function and use it by default, if getOperators prop is not passed
I would use specified global colors only, do not specify them separately here
the same for spacing: we have a predefined set of global spacings. I would use it

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              getOperators,
          
          
            
              getOperators = getDefaultOperators,
is it possible to have a NULLED or undefined query here?

seem to be, we want to emulate form submission here:
so we try to disable submit button, but we also have to handle success and failed state of form submission and "restore" button's state, here, in this function.

Suggested change
      
    
    
      
          
            
              customValueEditor,
          
          
            
              valueEditor = ValueEditor,
I would use a common word valueEditor

this is interesting:
What the reason of passing loading prop to a component.
There is a chance that parent component will always pass loading: true so, it may distract and confuse users.
Is it intentional to keep state management inside a component or not?
shouldn't we set a default value?

these two props are confusing: the first of is a number that is used by internal component to show the total number of results.
I think it was created especially to show this number inside a QueryBuilder.
isn't totalCount a maximum number of results in a response?
I wouldn't keep logic inside a component, I would rather move it to a separate hook
this also maybe be moved to a separate React hook
actually, the name of submitButtonClicked may confuse. What it is needed for?

react final form provides a good attribute meta which contains several information: valid, dirty state etc.
wdyt to reuse it and group relative attributes under meta?
I think this example is redundant.
this example is all odd. Let's skip it
Could you please explain, why RangeFieldOptions is defined in types, but RangeValue is here?
I would use isRangeValue function here with specified return value
better to use rems
I wouldn't pass context, instead, use this context via useContext or similar hook
I would use onClick here, we usually use on prefix for props
I would also take loading, totalCount and totalCountLoading from the context
we should use rems
these props ('path' | 'level' | 'schema') are defined in react-querybuilder, why do we need to omit them?
this is actually a bad practic, to set to unknown: we hide potential issue
use rems please

Left quite many comments.
To be honest, this PR is too big, I would ask you to split it on logic parts:

Core functionality
Custom components
Custom validation
sorry, now I can see, that I had a mistake in my first proposition 🙇  "@toptal/picasso": ">=38.0.0"
@dmaklygin these tests were my suggestion, we usually try to showcase the usage of all props of components. Do you think it is not needed?
Global styles are provided from core library, the styles we provide/override have global colors, isn't that enough? Do we still need to update global styles?
When we agree to change global styles here, I will make the change also. Not sure if it is necessary to update them atm.
Yes it can be undefined
Did not change the prop name for now but provided the default value as suggested. May change the prop name in another ticket since it introduces a breaking change.

Since I did not change the prop name, finalized it as:
controlElements={{ valueEditor: customValueEditor, }}

If we ever allowed a fallback option (like picasso is not availble as a dependency), we would return default ValueSelector from 'react-querybuilder',  and it would need path, schema and level props, but we do not render conditionally, we always return picasso Select.
Updated as flex: '1 0 9.25rem'
Updated as flex: '1 0 6.25rem'
This prop is provided directly from react-querybuilder to control elements
This prop is provided by react-querybuilder to every component. docs
Updated as  alignSelf: '1 0 3rem'
Not sure this is necessary, we know the values are RangeValue but we do not want to provide undefined values as a result.
Moved it to types, makes more sense for sure.
@TomasSlama @OleksandrNechai ping
I'm not sure why I'm pinged in this comment ;-)
set to true
Yes it is intended to show total number of results in a response. Would you suggest a prop name change or else?
Async work is done out of library if required and we can get loading state  as a prop and intentionally done this way, advice to improve?
Moved it.

node.title: Forms 7896 switch component2

<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

## Description

<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

## Related Issue

<!--- Every pull request must have a reference to a GitHub or Adobe internal issue. -->
<!--- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!--- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!--- Please link to the issue here: -->

## Motivation and Context

<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->

## How Has This Been Tested?

<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to -->
<!--- see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->

## Screenshots (if appropriate):

## Types of changes

<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

## Checklist:

<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->

- [ ] I have signed the [Adobe Open Source CLA](http://opensource.adobe.com/cla.html).
- [ ] My change requires a change to the documentation.
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] I have read the **CONTRIBUTING** document.
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes and the overall coverage did not decrease.
- [ ] All unit tests pass on CircleCi.
- [ ] I ran all tests locally and they pass.

node.bodyText: Do we have test case with enableUncheckedValue = false?
why do we have these image files in the PR?
If this code is repeated from checkbox, then we should have a common base class for both checkbox and switch

can we rename the class name like this -
"cmp-adaptiveform-switch__option cmp-adaptiveform-switch__option--on"

can we rename the class name like this -
"cmp-adaptiveform-switch__widget-label"

can we rename the class name like this -
"cmp-adaptiveform-switch__option cmp-adaptiveform-switch__option--off"

can we rename the class name like this -
"cmp-adaptiveform-switch__widget-container"
Please bump the minor version of package-info and add the new version here
Why is this overridden ?
This looks like dead code, base already does this ?
Can we rename this to, preserveUncheckedStateValue

Please add the following documentation for this so that it is clear
when a checkbox is not checked, it will still have a value representing its unchecked state, rather than having a null value. This configuration allows for a distinct value when the checkbox is in an unchecked state.
Please remove these thumbnails from test collateral, it should be clean

I think we decided to use the default state to signify the unchecked state. Also, the default value of checkbox is that if nothing is checked, we don't submit any value, which I think you have aligned too.
What if type is string, you should still enable the unchecked value state ? Why is this check required
Please use ES6 syntax, no usage of var please.
const offField = $(ENUM_OPTION)[0];
only BEM should be used to access elements, please fix the same.

This looks completely static and violates the structure (HTML) vs presentation (CSS) desig,. Ideal approach should be to separate the structure and presentation, making code cleaner and more maintainable.
We don't use _ anymore in code, please check the existing code and best practices
-1 for now
@rismehta  The default state is aligned with checkbox but the logic is different because we have enum and enumNames for switch
@rismehta This is updated in checkbox component also in this PR because switch component inherits dialog from checkbox
This might break existing forms, you can keep the property name as it was earlier.
Looks like this is borrowed from checkbox, can you create an abstract check box implementation and extend switch from checkbox to re-use the same code, the same logic should exist for checkbox too
check comments

When it comes to checkbox, we exclusively utilize enums and store them in two variables, namely 'checked' and 'unchecked.' However, in the case of switch, we store the enum values in an array while also saving the enumNames in a separate array. This is why we need to implement an override PostConstruct method
check comments
Please fix the js doc. Also why wasn't this part of the PR raised by @barshat7
This file was added later to have a common setModel and updateValue for switch and checkbox
Query: Why last 2 imports do not have .js - both work? still, can we have a consistency?
Including the .js extension when importing JavaScript modules is unnecessary and not recommended in ES6 syntax. We can change it in top four lines.

@egmox You mentioned - not recommended in ES6 syntax
Any reference for the same.
Reference I found which suggest otherwise:

https://nodejs.org/api/esm.html#mandatory-file-extensions
https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-52450/Use-file-extension-in-imports-if-type-module-is-used-in-package.json

These are the reference I followed.
https://medium.com/swlh/javascript-best-practices-module-imports-and-generators-8f593f681616
https://chat.openai.com/share/52a95f82-01e8-42c0-8ca8-069ca94f66f9
since it has conflicting suggestions from sites, lets have consistency in the code, and follow the existing code practice - to include the extension.
why skip?
why changed/removed?
based
Please review the description with the doc team
Display value is not sent to the backend - it is the data value which is sent. Please correct.
The variable was not being used
Can you make use of ComponentUtils.coerce for any type of coercion ?
Can you remove cq-htmlTag ? it is no longer required
Why is form panel imported here before copyright
Please revert these changes, its already merged by ravi

Please update Readme.md with all BEM blocks. For example, widget-checkbox is not present and it is documented here. I see some BEM like cmp-adaptiveform-switch__circle in the sightly but it is not mentioned here
Please mention that switch extends from checkbox
This BEM is not clear, looks like this is some indicator, can you rename this to __circle-indicator
Can you create an AbstractCheckBoxImpl and re-use it in SwitchImpl for better maintenance ?
check comments
Idea of creating abstract implementation was to re-use code which I still don't see with these changes. Please schedule a discussion to close this.
You have made the implementation more complex
check comments
Please change the version, I just merged @im-shiv changes
Why do you need to override this ? enumNames is anyways protected
Even this is not required.
Why are you accessing super in here, when this is not overridden ?
Initialization of enum names should be part of Switch since enum names are not relevant for check box. It won't make a difference functionally, but the code would be more readable.
please sync shivam's changes to support rich text in switch and check comments
Can you check minor comments
-- signifies modifier where as container is not a modifier, this should be cmp-adaptiveform-switch__label-container
__widget-label
widget-slider
circle-indicator
-1 for now
I am merging this PR, please update package-info and java doc since the latest version is 4.6.0. not sure why the maven plugin is not reporting to update the minor version
Can you update the package info since I have merged barshat's PR
Please update the authoring test to use cleanTest and retry combo, if the test is flaky
check comments
